definition: to support/to sustain/to erect/to raise/branch/division/to draw money/classifier for rods such as pens and guns, for army divisions and for songs or compositions

to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc

sentences.english: Spending such a large number of companies is how to design costs?
sentences.chinese: 多支出這麼大的設計費公司內是怎麼討論的呢？

sentences.english: All their costs, including study and living expenses, will be covered by the fund.
sentences.chinese: 包括通信費在內的大部分支出，都會由公司支付。

sentences.english: Certain other expenses also may be deducted from taxable income, or one may elect to use the "standard deduction.
sentences.chinese: 某些其他支出也可從應繳納的個人收入稅中扣除。

sentences.english: Provide for appropriate financial and cost analysis related to any proposed capital expenditures or divestitures .
sentences.chinese: 爲資金支出或財產剝奪提供正確的財政及成本分析。

sentences.english: Reducing spending while still investing in the future is just common sense.
sentences.chinese: 減少支出並投資未來是一個基本常識。

sentences.english: The average outgo of the is 2000 dollars.
sentences.chinese: 工廠蹬平菌支出是二遷美元。

sentences.english: Spending a couple of hours on grinding will reward you back with hundreds of wow gold.
sentences.chinese: 磨削將獎勵支出與數百謝文東你回來了幾個小時。

sentences.english: Comparative National Institute of Health expenditure on tobacco compared with other health problems.
sentences.chinese: 比較國家菸草研究所與支出相比其他健康問題的健康。

sentences.english: The other big corporate tax change now occurring will be negative for capital spending.
sentences.chinese: 目前另一項公司稅收大變動不利於資本支出。

sentences.english: They too have overindulged in short-term spending rather than long-term investment.
sentences.chinese: 他們過分關注短期支出而非長期投資。

sentences.english: Countries use it to compile basic health statistics and to monitor health spending.
sentences.chinese: 國家用其彙編基本衛生統計和監測衛生支出。

sentences.english: Individual incomes are rising and supportive of steady growth in consumer spending.
sentences.chinese: 個人收入正在上升，有利於消費支出的穩定增長。

sentences.english: Moreover, public spending seems to have odd knock-off effects.
sentences.chinese: 此外，公共支出似乎具有怪異的連鎖效應。

sentences.english: So where's the evidence that an antibusiness climate is depressing spending?
sentences.chinese: 因此，說反公司的氣候在抑制支出，證據何在？

sentences.english: Some of the equipment is expensive, but hygienists don't cost much.
sentences.chinese: 有些設備很昂貴，但是衛生員的支出並不高。

sentences.english: Most of us know the never-ending cycle of living paycheck to paycheck.
sentences.chinese: 我們大多數人都知道生活支出無休無止。

definition: expenditures/expenses/CL:筆|笔[bi3], 項|项[xiang4]/to spend money/(coll.) to pay wages
